[23/6/2023, 12:16:45â€¯PM] ~â€¯Raghav Rao: HK Passport / Chinese Nationality Details and run down 

1. Steps
2. Expense



HK Passport & Nationality details 
###########
Applied nationality 11 Dec 2015
Paid processing fee $1730
now Wait - 10 month (sep-oct2016)
later:  

Receive Letter (approval in principle, now you get one year window to reconsider and actually apply)

Give up Nationality at Indian Consulate 

Contact Immegration and change HKID with 3-stars
Then apply Hk Passport 


<<<IMPORTANT >>>
APPLICATION STATUS - if some change happens which impact application then inform Immegration.
OFFICER SAID: If you move from your house then inform (otherwise letter will go to old address)


<<STEPS>>>

Step 1.
Apply for Naturalization as a Chinese National.
Apply at Immigration office in Wanchai on 4th Floor.
Bring completed form and all original certificates.
Officer will interview in Cantonese (English also ok) and check all documents. 

If officer is satisfied, pay 50% deposit and wait for their information.

Processing time was 9 months.
At approval, Immigration depâ€™t will send approval notice by mail.


Step 2.
Renounce Indian passport.
Apply at Indian consulate 9:30-12:00
Bring:
Form 17 X 2 copies. Sign form in front of the officer.
Passport size 2â€X2â€ photos X 2 in white background. (Fotomax at United Centre) 
Nationalization approval letter copy. 
Latest Passport and copy
All Old Passports original. 
Pay $1170 advance.
Collect renunciation cert, signed form 17 and cancelled last Passport on the following day. 

Remark: they Didn't check old Passports and no need residence proof. But they can ask all this.

Step 3.
Apply for Chinese Naturalization Cert.
Apply at Immigration Tower 4th Floor
Bring:
Naturalization approval letter
Renounce Indian Passport Cert and signed form 17
Pay balance 50% fee.
Receive Naturalization cert immediately.
Received another sealed envelope containing letter for new HKID .

Step 4.
Apply for new HKID. (Apply immediately after receiving Naturalization certificate as they have walk in quota in the morning)

Apply at 8th Floor
Bring:
Naturalization certificate
Sealed envelope
HK Permanent ID.
Write Chinese name and sign in front of the officer in Chinese.
Pay HKD420

Will receive HKID acknowledgement and receive new HKID in 3 weeks.
Cannot speed up.

<TIP> for parallel application to Apply â€˜Certificate of registered Particularsâ€™ @HK$425 after HKID, takes 4-5 weeks. It is needed to apply for China Card (not for HKSAR Passport). Better enquire whether it can be requested at the time of applying HKID card?

Step 5.
Apply for HK Passport. (Apply *immediately* after applying for new HKID as they have walk in quota in the morning)

Apply at 4th Floor
Bring:
Completed form
Acknowledgement of HKID
Naturalization certificate
Renounce Indian passport Certificate and signed form 17
Pay HKD480 for 48pages.
Can speed up to 4 working days but need evidence of urgent business travel like e-ticket, company letter and name card.
Normal processing time is 2 weeks

Step 6.
Apply for Home return card <it can take Many Months ~6-8 months. In my case it was available within a month. I guess,  those who travel frequently to China gets it much much later as it happened with my friend >
Apply at CTS Lek Yuen.
Take photo there $40
Bring:
Temporary HKID and 2 copies
HK passport and 2 copies
Right of Abode letter issued at the time of receiving Permanent ID and 2 copies
Naturalization cert and 2 copies
All old Indian passports.
Renunciation of Indian Passport Certificate and signed form 17 and 2 copies.
Officer will check records of first entry to Mainland China, first entry to HKSAR under Employment visa, Last HKSAR employment visa, if any job change in between, Current China visa status etc and prepare a statement on your behalf.
Check all and sign. 

Applied temporary permit in parallel.

Step 7.
Apply for OCI (30-Dec)
Apply online
Print a copy of online application form
Send online application Reference number to Indian consulate by e-mail and request for an interview.
Received interview appointment e-mail (They reply after few days + Give appointment after few weeks :-{{  )

Attend interview and the officer checked all documents in original.
Officer will inform you, that youâ€™ll get email after few days whether your application is approved (meaning processable). 
Only after that you can come to pay for OCI fee. Fees is only acceptable on FRIDAY and in Cash. No other day , no online transfer , no advance payment :-{{. 
 Can request your friend etc to go and deposit fees if you are travelling.

Application got approved in 2 days. Submitted $2170 fee on Friday (no need to go in person).
OCI fee can be paid only on Fridays from 9:30 to 12 noon.
After paying fee, it takes 35 days to get OCI and lifelong visa.
Check OCI status online. When it shows Documents recâ€™d at Hong Kong date than go to Indian Consulate on any working day from 9:30AM to 12noon to collect OCI card and lifelong visa.
Collected OCI card and lifelong visa.




#2 Expense

A) Nationality @Application -  HK1760
B) India Passport Surrender / Renounce - HK$ 1170
 c) nationality @Approval - $1760
D) HkId (adding chinese name )$460
E) HK Passport (1 month) - 
F) India OCI - HK$ 2170
G) Certificate of Registered Particulars -HK$ 425 (fo tan)(3-4 week)
H) China Entry Card-$550
~ Hk$ 8000f

Remember - it is overall Expensive.  

you need two things ASAP. HK passport so you can travel. 
And OCI for India . OCI process is unnecessarily long , so just get it done asap once you have passport (can apply visa in the interim)

[2/8/2023, 8:55:22â€¯PM] ~â€¯Raghav Rao: *ğŸ‡®ğŸ‡³ğŸ’°ADVERTISEMENT- BY DONATION( HKD50) TO CHARITY IN HKğŸ’°ğŸ‡®ğŸ‡³*

Dear participants,

We are excited to share that our upcoming *English workshop*  will be held at the Laguna Verde Clubhouse from 21st Aug to 26th Aug. We have designed various courses catering to different age groups, including kindergarten, primary, and secondary students. Below are the courses we will be offering:

1) *Debate - 21st Aug to 26th Aug, 12 pm to 1 pm*
In our Debate Class, children will learn critical thinking, effective communication, persuasive argumentation, research techniques, and confident speech delivery.
*Ages: 6-15*

2) *Phonics (Jolly Phonics) - 21st Aug to 26th Aug, 1 pm to 2 pm*
children will learn fundamental phonics skills such as letter-sound correspondence, decoding, blending, segmenting, sight word recognition, and phonemic awareness, which are crucial for building a strong foundation in reading and spelling.
*Ages: 4-9*

3) *Creative Writing - 21st Aug to 26th Aug, 2 pm to 3 pm*
In our Creative Writing class, children will learn the art of storytelling, develop their imagination and creativity, improve their writing skills, explore different genres, and gain confidence in expressing their ideas through engaging writing exercises
Ages: 6-15

4) *Speaking and Listening - 21st Aug to 26th Aug, 3 pm to 4 pm*
In our Speaking and Listening class, children will learn communication skills like active listening, public speaking, engaging in meaningful conversations, interview preparation, and partner talk, followed by Storytelling. 
Ages: 6-15

6) *Reading and Grammar - 21st Aug to 26th Aug, 5 pm to 6 pm*
Improve your reading comprehension skills and brush up on grammar knowledge. Engage in comprehension passages, grammar exercises, and vocabulary building. This course is suitable for primary.
Ages: 6-15

7) *One-on-One Classes - 21st Aug to 26th Aug, 6 pm to 7 pm*
Get personalized attention and guidance from our experienced instructors. This option is perfect for individuals looking for extra support in any specific area of English.

Please note the following:
- Workbooks will be provided 
- There are only 5 students per class, except for the one-on-one classes. 
- For pricing information, please send us a direct message. +852 61415496
- The timings are subject to change 
- deadline for registration is Friday, 18th August 

Take advantage of this fantastic opportunity to improve your English skills!

Best Regard:
Ms Khush
Fun With English
+852 61415496

[26/8/2023, 9:28:37â€¯AM] ~â€¯Raghav Rao: *"Sil Suwandai - Hela Diviyayi" ~ Authentic Sri Lankan Cuisine Ceremony Offering to Lord Buddha, Monks and Devotees.*

Under the proposal and guidance of the Regional Food Promotion National Program of the President's Office, the Authentic Sri Lankan Cuisine Ceremony will be held on *Sunday, August 27, at the premises of "Ceylon Farm Village" in Sheung Shui,* affiliated to the Sri Lankan Buddhist Cultural Center in Hong Kong, according to the concept of "Sil Suwandai - Hela Diviyay ~ The Buddhist Way of Lifeâ€
Authentic Sri Lankan cuisine is a vibrant and diverse culinary tapestry that reflects the island nation's rich history, cultural influences, and unique geography.

The cuisine showcases an array of aromatic spices, tropical ingredients, and traditional cooking techniques passed down through generations.
Staple ingredients in Sri Lankan cooking are as diverse as the island nation's rich cultural heritage. Rice, a dietary staple, takes center stage in almost every meal, often accompanied by an array of aromatic curries. Coconut and its derivatives play a crucial role in Sri Lankan cuisine, with coconut milk and grated coconut lending their creamy texture to curries and desserts.
Spices such as cinnamon, cardamom, cloves, and cumin infuse dishes with deep flavors while adding a distinct aroma.
These spices not only provide an explosion of taste but also offer various health benefits due to their natural medicinal properties. The artful use of spices reflects the mastery and creativity of Sri Lankan chefs who skillfully blend these ingredients to create tantalizing culinary experiences.

Farmers in Sri Lanka offer their first batch of produce to the village Buddhist temple and traditional households offer the first portion of their daily meal to Lord Buddha.

*We cordially invite you to experience this journey, offering and tasting the meals which created using Authentic Sri Lankan Ingredients, according to traditional recipes.*

Ceylon farm village ~ "Ape Gama"
Sri Lankan Buddhist Cultural Centre - Hong Kong
530 Hang Tau Rd, Kwu tung, Sheung Shui.
53608945 / 96183249 / 53437269 / 95785253 / 56173856
info@slbcchk.com

*NEW RULE* in _order to streamline promotional activities_ 



From 9th September 2023 , Advertisements will be posted only twice a week -  on *Saturdays and Wednesdays* 

_*EXCEPTIONS*_


If any event based /time based advertisements, like a movie promotion, which *cannot wait until next posting day* *we will post IMMEDIATELY* as a special case (since we should not be biased towards other advertisers, min donation *will be HKD75* if you want to post on same day for an event /time based program thatâ€™s falling within next 3 days.

For example -  if you want to advertise on a Thursday  for a event that is falling on next day / same week Saturday /Sunday event, then we will post immediately. 

Other example- if you want to post on a Monday for a Tuesday (next day) event , we will post immediately , upon paying hkd75 to a registered charity 

This additional donation is just to accommodate urgent event , which canâ€™t wait for regular advertising slots and we will not post normal promotional content immediately even if you pay hkd75.

Hope clear

[2/9/2023, 10:26:35â€¯PM] ~â€¯Raghav Rao: Dear Members 

###################

*We will appreciate if you could Pls forward this to your other local groups/ friends / spouse/ adult kids so they  can join help group*
#################

 


We would like to introduce HELP GROUP HK, an informal association of individuals within a WhatsApp community that has remained active for the past 8 years. Our primary objective is to foster a sense of unity and mutual assistance among more than 5000 Hong Kong Indians.

It is important to note that our community strictly *prohibits the exchange of personal monetary incentives*. Furthermore, we kindly request members to *refrain from sharing greetings, pleasantries, or forwarding unverified messages, videos, or other inappropriate content*.

Our platform has played a pivotal role in connecting individuals with job opportunities, with approximately 2000 individuals successfully securing employment through our HELP groups.

Additionally, we offer members the opportunity to promote their businesses or properties by making a charitable donation of HKD 50 to a *Hong Kong-registered charity*.

In closing, we firmly believe in the adage that *"One cannot help everyone, but everyone can help someone"* Thus, we encourage all members to actively engage in the spirit of mutual support and collaboration within our community.

Join us here: 


https://chat.whatsapp.com/HHVtWcAGdiaFHEWK9eT1AF

*We will appreciate if you could Pls forward this to your other local Hk groups/ friends / spouse/ adult kids so they  can join help group*

[10/9/2023, 12:26:55â€¯PM] ~â€¯Raghav Rao: *Announcement regarding Advertising and  Schedule*

**New Advertising Schedule:**
Advertisements will now be posted on **Saturdays and Wednesdays** starting 9th September 2023.

**Urgent Postings:** 
For time-sensitive promotions (e.g., events within the next 3 days), an immediate post can be arranged with a mandatory HKD75 donation to a designated charity.

**NOTE:** 
This urgent posting fee is *only* for time-sensitive events. Regular promotional content won't be posted immediately even with the fee.

We have made these changes considering feedback from members to review number of advertisements being posted. We will continue to incorporate feedback to make the groups purposeful.
For any clarifications, contact the admin directly.

All other conditions remain same and itâ€™s in group description, providing the link below for easy reference 
https://hkhelp.page.link/AY2a


Thank you,
*ADMIN*
[10/9/2023, 12:28:30â€¯PM] ~â€¯Butt hina: Dear Parents,
 
Are you feeling overwhelmed by the Primary One Admission (POA) process? Or perhaps you're unsure about how to best prepare your child for the transition from kindergarten to primary school? We understand the challenges you may be facing, and we are here to provide you with the information you need!
 
We represent Oxfam and have an exciting opportunity we'd like to share with you. We have created a video tutorial that demonstrates how to properly fill in the form for a discretionary place. If you're interested in gaining a deeper understanding of the POA system and acquiring valuable educational resources to teach Chinese to your children, we invite you to participate in a brief survey that will only take approximately 5 minutes of your time.
 
By completing the survey, you will be eligible to receive a curated selection of educational materials that we will distribute to you. These resources are designed to enhance your teaching capabilities and provide valuable insights into teaching Chinese effectively.
 
To take advantage of this offer and access the educational resources, kindly fill out the survey at your earliest convenience. Your participation will greatly contribute to the success of our initiative and enable us to better tailor the distribution of resources to meet your specific needs.
 
Thank you for your interest and support. We look forward to your response and the opportunity to assist you in your educational endeavors. If you have any questions about POA system or about the survey, please contact Ms. Yip at 6110 6408.
 
The Video of Discretionary Place Form Filling: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1Ai3fCW74ee4fSavSyHu7uYii70WG17JS/view?usp=sharing
Google survey Link:
https://forms.gle/Qa7Je855unHSZsDz6
 
Best regards,
The Oxfam Team

**New Advertising Schedule:**
Advertisements will now be posted on **Saturdays and Wednesdays** starting 9th September 2023.

**Urgent Postings:** 
For time-sensitive promotions (e.g., events within the next 3 days), an immediate post can be arranged with a mandatory HKD75 donation to a designated charity.

**NOTE:** 
This urgent posting fee is *only* for time-sensitive events. Regular promotional content won't be posted immediately even with the fee.

We have made these changes considering feedback from members to review number of advertisements being posted. We will continue to incorporate feedback to make the groups purposeful.
For any clarifications, contact the admin directly.

[16/10/2023, 8:56:44â€¯AM] ~â€¯Raghav Rao: Hello Rao

Happy to share the Indian  helper employment contract renew process:

1. Get the ID 441, blue form from the HK immigration department - 4 of these.

2. Take BLS appointment for form filling (in case of doubts) and submission back to back.

3. Once form is fully filled, sign by both helper & employer & submit it at BLS for attestation by Indian consulate - takes 3-5 working days

4. Once you receive the form - 3 copies as Indian consulate will keep 1 for its record, make sure itâ€™s attested fully. In next step can submit to HK immigration  for online renewal - 
https://www.immd.gov.hk/eng/services/visas/fdh/smartrenewal.html

The above website will first ask details of helper name, age, DOB, nationality etc. (upload below scanned document HKID, existing visa pages, passport front, back & last travel stamp if any) plus the scan copy of new employment form. You can apply for extension of stay which means after 1 year of the next contract your helper will need to travel outside to home or in some cases if agreed between employer & helper the visa can be extended again without travel, to activate the remaining 1 year of the visa. -The online form other parts are employer details on HKID, passport (if on working visa), address proof through utility bills - not older than 3 months, Financial proof - Bank statement or payslips - best to give 3 months record. 
5. The HK immigration step for approval takes 10-15 business days, however in 2-3 business days you should receive acknowledgment of submitting application.

6. HK immigration might contact directly on phone or email in case any further docs are needed. Once the processing completes you can download the evisa by paying online.
[16/10/2023, 8:56:46â€¯AM] ~â€¯Raghav Rao: Total fees with above process is:

BLS charge approx: 300-500 HKD
VISA fees: 230 HKD

PS: above case have not bought tickets yet as itâ€™s an year extension with helper to travel after 1 year to activate next half of the visa.

[13/12/2023, 10:33:07â€¯AM] ~â€¯Sanjay Surana: Admin, Please forward this message to all the groups. 

*Job Vacancy*

We are looking for a full-time accountant!

Qualifications:
-Degree holder in accounting  with qualification in professional accounting body
-3 years prior-experience in Accounting role
-Well-versed in Tally (3 years experience)
-Understanding of how to deal with multi-currency function on Tally
-Proficiency in MS office suite (Excel and Word)
-Speaks English and Hindi (preferred)
-Responsible, self-motivated, willing to learn, independent, and works well under pressure

Responsibilities:
-Input all sales Invoices / payments / expenses
-Enter all accounting vouchers on Tally
-Fixed Deposits entry and cash accounting 
-Bank reconciliation
-Daily Stock summary reporting
-Daily Sales summary reporting
